results.title: Cyberthon V: Spectrum 7 - Violet
results.brief_description:
Cyberthon V: Spectrum 7 – Violet was broadcast as the seventh of eight in an episodic series on Channel 31 in Melbourne. This format allowed for the creation of tighter, curated segments for broadcast instead of the impromptu, marathon-like events of the previous Cyberthons.

As well as electronic music, art, remixed footage (from previous Cyberthon events), guerrilla style music videos, drug and rave safe promotions, experimental performances and short films, global participation was also encouraged via online production meetings. As Cyberthon curator Adem Jaffers said “Cyberthon had become a public TV ‘Access Show’ nested within a public TV ‘Access Channel’ [which was] quite unique really!”

A selection of artists: Tekno Mandala (Adem Jaffers), Future Films (Jeff Jaffers), Third Eye ‘Ambi Jam’ (Gus Till, Ollie Olsen, Geoffrey Hales, Simon Polinski), Cyberdada (Troy Innocent & Dale Nason), Phuture (Crissie Seivers and M. Buchanan ‘Equinox Comics’), Stelarc, Theatre TV (Eliza, Mari Giambanco and Julie Turner), Space Between the Gaps (Paul Gafney), Corruption & Vice (Ju-Ann Lam), abcTVxyz (Dale Nason and Kim Bounds) and Dont Shoot The Messenger (Steve Middleton)

Cyberthon VII: Spectrum 7 – Violet is part of the Cyberthon Archive generously donated to ACMI by Adem Jaffers.

results.title: [John Anderson Home Movies: Reel 4 and Reel 5] [excerpts]
results.brief_description:
John Robert (Jack) Anderson (1924–1993) was a film distributor, cinema owner and photographer as well as an enthusiastic filmmaker in and around Ballarat in Victoria. Jack developed an interest in film very early at cinema shows and gained his first film experience while serving in WWII, photographing wartime conditions and aircraft involved in the defence of Australia’s north, including the aftermath of the Darwin bombing raid.

It was whilst working in photographic studios that Jack met his future wife, business partner and fellow film enthusiast Marie Bourke. Starting out by hiring films and showing them around regional Victoria, Jack and Marie established cinemas such as the Astor Cinema in Ararat, Bell Post Hill Drive-In in Geelong and the Southern and Northern Drive-Ins and Vegas 70 Cinema in Ballarat. In the 1970s, the Anderson family acquired and restored the Regent Theatre in Ballarat which would then become the first multiplex in regional Victoria.

Along the way, Jack filmed his family and friends activities and outings, horse racing, Ballarat street scenes, motorcycle scrambling and travel scenes on the road – an unusual and wonderful look at life in regional Victoria during the 1940s to the 1960s.

The collection is filmed on 16mm and 9.5mm film and the films can sometimes be a bit damaged and shaky.

This 9.5mm example is from excerpts of Reels 4 and 5, showing scenes of Jack’s family and friends enjoying their scrambler motor bikes in muddy conditions at Korweinguboora, near Ballarat, Victoria. A group of friends are then shown travelling around the Victorian countryside on motorcycles (motorbikes). Motorcycles have been filmed from a vehicle travelling alongside. The bike riders gather for the camera at the ‘Atlantic Garage’ possibly in Ballarat and then head off for a ride down a dusty country road.

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 17. Olympic Pool 1943]  [excerpt]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This excerpt taken from the complete work on Reel 17, shows people enjoying the water and sunshine at the former State Swimming Centre (now demolished) in Batman Avenue, Melbourne. Being 1943, those enjoying the Olympic-sized pool and its facilities include soldiers in uniform as well as those displaying the various swimwear styles of the 1940s. There are sequences of diving from the high diving-boards, underwater scenes, and people sunbaking, swimming and enjoying themselves. The footage also shows glimpses of landmark buildings of Melbourne at the time, the pool and some of its surrounding seating and walkways. Three landmark Melbourne buildings in the background; St Paul’s Cathedral, the Forum Theatre, and the T&G Building (Temperance and General Building).

The open-air Olympic Pool (formally known as the State Swimming Centre) was built by the Melbourne City Council, and opened in Batman Avenue, Melbourne in 1935. It was Melbourne’s first Olympic-sized pool, and was also known as the Beaurepaire Pool (named after champion swimmer Sir Frank Beaurepaire who was also Melbourne’s Lord Mayor 1940-1942).

results.title: [Charles Hayes Home Movies: Reel 3. Moomba 1964] [excerpt]
results.brief_description:
The Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 8mm and 9.5mm film between the 1940s and 1970s by Charles Edward Hayes (1914–1993). The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

This is an excerpt from Reel 3 showing Melbourne’s Moomba street parade 1964, featuring colourful parade floats, marching girls, musicians and popular personalities of the day. The floats are assembled at the top of Swanston St before they head off for the big parade.

results.title: [KenRa Films Present Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 12. Car Racing] [excerpt]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This excerpt of Reel 12 of the film shows the family at a motor sport event held 1957 - 1959 Albert Park. A printed program reads ‘Second Day: 24th March 1957, Victorian Trophy Race, Organised by the Light Car Club of Australia’. The Light Car Club of Australia held motor races at Albert Park in between 1953 and 1958.

results.title: [Remix: Sunnies]
results.creator_credit: Sam Mapplebeck, ACMI Collections and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Worn at the beach or on a bush walk, or simply as a style statement, this playful short film is a tribute to the fashion accessory, and sun-smart, sun glasses. Set to a boss nova soundtrack, this short work is a tribute to ‘shades’, showing people wearing sun glasses cut from home movies and short works in the ACMI Collection. Featured are some of fashion’s best styles of eye wear from the 1940s to the 1970s.

ACMI gratefully acknowledge the following donors and creators in the compilation of this work: Tasmanian Archive and Heritage Office; Elenor Peach; Barry Parsons; The Gadsden Family and Neville Daley.

results.title: [Charles Hayes Home Movies: Reel 3]
results.brief_description:
The Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 8mm and 9.5mm film between the 1940s and 1970s by Charles Edward Hayes (1914–1993). The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

This is a composite film of different segments – a family reunion at Halls Gap in 1973 where we see typical barbeques of the era – a small round three legged hotplate and a ‘trough’ style both stacked with 1970’s barbeque fare – lots of lamb chops. We also see the fashions of the 1970’s in the velvets, flares, knee high socks and long hair. ‘Sandown Park with Jack Brabham’ introduces a segment of vintage racing cars and favourite car driver of the day, Jack Brabham signing autographs and smiling at the camera.

The film also includes some Moomba parade floats and marching girls, some city scenes of Melbourne and the Yarra Heliport and Ansett-ANA helicopter and finishes with some up close footage on the set of ‘World of Sport’, a very popular television sports show of the era featuring Lou Richards, Jack Dyer and Ron Casey among others.

Originally made using Standard 8mm film.

results.title: Flash Back: ACMI Collections Mash-up White Night 2017
results.brief_description:
‘Flash Back’, an archival mashup of films and footage from the 1940s through to the ‘80s celebrating the changing face of Australian youth identity and culture.

From rebel youth of the ‘50s, to the ‘70s counter culture revolution and the punk attitudes of the ‘80s, ‘Flash Back’ explores the changing decades through diverse subcultures and the music, fashions and cultural preoccupations that shaped them.

Image: ‘Sharpies: A Gathering’, courtesy Greg Macainsh

Our sincere thanks to filmmakers, musicians and donors for material used in this work. Full details in credits. Edited by ACMI’s Sam Mapplebeck.

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 23]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film shows the Australian ‘outback’, focussing on Alice Springs. The start of the reel has shots of roads, erosion alongside the roads, surrounding countryside and distant views as well as Kenneth’s car on the road - an image he often used to indicate the film will capture a roadtrip.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:00:00 starts with a title card ‘Hello Alice’.

00:31:00:00 Map of Australia honing in on Alice Springs.

00:46:00:00 sign ‘Pichi Richi Pass - Caution - Creeks and Corners’.

00:1:09:0000:01:47:00 we sight a small steam train.

00:02:10:00 a rail bridge.

00:02:38:00 travellers arrive at the township of Quorn (South Australia)

00:03:01:00 the Quorn train station; long transport steam trains. sign for the township of Marree.

00:04:15:00 footage includes looking at the wheels and tracks, passengers awaiting trains, local Indigenous people, scenes of the outback taken from the train.

00:06:10:00 the traintrip reaches the township of Beresford and then the William Creek Hotel at 00:06:40:00 where we see passengers having fetched bottles of beer from the hotel sprinting back to the train.

00:06:50:00 a glimpse of (probably) brumbies and more scenes of locals and the surrounding countryside from travelling train.

00:09:27:00 we sight traindrivers or workers walking alongside the train, travel by a sheep station and through a very arid landscape.

00:10:20:00 the sign for Alice Springs comes into view. Kenneth starts a tour of the town with some police officers speaking to the camera and footage of families and their cars in one of the streets. Footage includes wandering around the wide dusty roads, people walking and on bicycles and then a look at the buildings - houses, a focus on an older building made (unusually of brick), eucalyptus trees and a flowering garden,

00:11:33:00 we see a sign for the ‘Australian Inland Mission Hostel for bush mothers and children’ on a building that Kenneth gives us several views of including a motorbike outside. This is followed by a view of a new and very modern looking building, surrounded by vegetable or market gardens and out front of which Mrs Rankine chats with acquaintances who point her up to a monument on a hill.

00:12:10:00 is a view from the monument, overlooking the town including views of its oval and what appears to be a prison.

00:13:19:00 view of eucalypts in the surrounding landscape.

00:13:40:00 we see a marker for ‘Flynn’s Grave’ which is a beautiful boulder perched on a stone pedestal.

00:14:04:00 a sign for ‘Standley Chasm’ appears and begins a sequence of dramatic and beautiful scenes of rocky outcrops, foliage and trees. Kenneth films some walkers among the rocks which shows the size and context of the environment.

00:15:31:00 we see two Indigenous horsemen followed by a sign for ‘Hermannsberg’ and some shots of the mission church building, some members of the community and a group of children smiling for the camera. The reel ends with some last looks at the landscape.

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 19]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film shows views across the Melbourne CBD rooftops and steeples, a selection of ‘flowering gums’, a visit to the Botanical Gardens, the arrival of ‘flat tops’ aircraft carrier ships. Kenneth then shows off the neon signs of Melbourne at night.

Selected highlights list:

00:00:20:00 title ‘Melbourne’.

00:00:26:00 views from what appears to be the top of the Royal Melbourne Children’s Hospital in North Melbourne with a note, ‘From Here 178 Feet’ beginning with a view down Elizabeth St toward the CBD.

00:01:06:00 an eastern view, where the Dandenong Ranges can be seen in the distance.

00:01:28:00 to 00:01:37:00 views over Melbourne University toward Queen’s College and the Royal Exhibition Building.

00:01:58:00 a horse and cart enter a city intersection at same time as a tram and cars.

00:02:47:00 Melbourne Technical College rotunda.

00:03:05:00 the Pelaco sign in Richmond (a Heritage Victoria listed landmark). Pelaco is a Melbourne based shirt manufacturing business.

00:30:00:00 Elizabeth St with Flinders St Station in view ends the footage of the rooftops of Melbourne.

00:04:30:00 title card ‘Flowering Gums’ followed by a selection of trees and shrubs in flower.

00:06:52:00 title card ‘Botanical Gardens’ begins a look at people enjoying the gardens. Footage includes examples of fox furs being worn by some women strolling in the gardens.

00:09:28:00 a quick look at what appears to be Captain Cook’s cottage.

00:09:35:00 title card ‘V.A.C.S On Location’ begins a sequence of what appears to be a film being made.

00:10:45:00 title card ‘The Flat Tops Arrive’ footage of large ships (aircraft carriers) and tugboats in the bay viewed by watchers on a small pier near, presumably, Port Melbourne.

00:12:42:00 a plane goes overhead. The sequence ends at at night on the beach. with people overlooking the bay toward the horizon.

00:15:11:00 title ‘Bright Lights’, a sequence at night showing neon signs around Melbourne.

00:16:03:00 the face of Luna Park in St Kilda.

00:16:24:00 Fostor’s Lager advertising sign.

00:16:35:00 Berger Paints (British Paints) advertising sign.

00:16:40:00 to 00:16:55:00 Swallows and Ariells ‘Follow the Swallow’ sequenced advertisement for Uneeda Biscuits, Plum Pudding and Biscuits Cakes Ice cream.

00:16:58:00 Sunshine Milk advertising sign.

00:17:15:00 Ball and Welch department store sign on Flinders St with the T&G Building sign in the background.

00:17:23:00 shows a longer sequence advertisement for Sennets ice cream featuring a bear eating an ice cream.

00:18:00:00 possibly the top dome of the Royal Exhibition Building lit up.

00:18:25:00 ‘Visit the Zoo’ advertising flashes up on screen.

00:19:05:00 advertisement ‘Mascot Underwear for Men and Boys’ featuring a ram and lamb on his back.

00:19:09:00 ‘Dunlop Tyres’ advertising sign.

00:19:33:00 footage ends with blurred city lights and traffic lights turning to red.

00:16:35:00 Berger Paints (British Paints) advertising sign.

00:16:40:00 to 00:16:55:00 Swallows and Ariells ‘Follow the Swallow’ sequenced advertisement for Uneeda Biscuits, Plum Pudding and Biscuits Cakes Ice cream.

00:16:58:00 Sunshine Milk advertising sign.

00:17:15:00 Ball and Welch department store sign on Flinders St with the T&G Building sign in the background.

00:17:23:00 shows a longer sequence advertisement for Sennets ice cream featuring a bear eating an ice cream.

00:18:00:00 possibly the top dome of the Royal Exhibition Building lit up.

00:18:25:00 ‘Visit the Zoo’ advertising flashes up on screen.

00:19:05:00 advertisement ‘Mascot Underwear for Men and Boys’ featuring a ram and lamb on his back.

00:19:09:00 ‘Dunlop Tyres’ advertising sign.

00:19:33:00 footage ends with blurred city lights and traffic lights turning to red.
